title: Complements on direct products
content: A few utility theorems on direct products.

blocks.name: bj-xpimasn
blocks.content: The image of a singleton, general case. [Change and relabel ~ xpimasn accordingly, maybe to xpima2sn.] (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-xpima1sn
blocks.content: The image of a singleton by a direct product, empty case. [Change and relabel ~ xpimasn accordingly, maybe to xpima2sn.] (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-xpima1snALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ bj-xpima1sn . (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-xpima2sn
blocks.content: The image of a singleton by a direct product, nonempty case. [To replace ~ xpimasn ] (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-xpnzex
blocks.content: If the first factor of a product is nonempty, and the product is a set, then the second factor is a set. UPDATE: this is actually the curried (exported) form of ~ xpexcnv (up to commutation in the product). (Contributed by BJ, 6-Oct-2018.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-xpnzex(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe)))
} = {
  pm2.61ine(c1, emptycls, wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe))))
  a1d(wceq(c1, emptycls), wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe)))
  a1d(wceq(c1, emptycls), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe))
  ax-mp(wi(wceq(c1, emptycls), wcel(c1, universe)), wcel(emptycls, universe))
  0ex()
  eleq1a(emptycls, universe, c1)
  expcom(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe)))
  sylbi(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wne(c1, emptycls)), wi(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe)), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls))
  xpnz(c0, c1)
  expcom(wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe))
  simprd(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  xpexr2(c0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: bj-xpexg2
blocks.content: Curried (exported) form of ~ xpexg . (Contributed by BJ, 2-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-xpnzexb
blocks.content: If the first factor of a product is a nonempty set, then the product is a set if and only if the second factor is a set. (Contributed by BJ, 2-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-cleq
blocks.content: Substitution property for certain classes. (Contributed by BJ, 2-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-cleq(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cab(s0, wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c0, c2))), cab(s0, wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c1, c2)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylib(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cab(s0, wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c0, c2))), cab(s0, wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c1, c2)))), wal(s0, wb(wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c0, c2)), wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c1, c2)))))
  syl(wceq(c0, c1), wal(s0, wb(wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c0, c2)), wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c1, c2)))), wceq(cima(c0, c2), cima(c1, c2)))
  imaeq1(c0, c1, c2)
  alrimiv(s0, wceq(cima(c0, c2), cima(c1, c2)), wb(wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c0, c2)), wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c1, c2))))
  eleq2(cima(c0, c2), cima(c1, c2), csn(cv(s0)))
  abbi(s0, wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c0, c2)), wcel(csn(cv(s0)), cima(c1, c2)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cima(c0, c2), cima(c1, c2))
  diff.cima.s(s0, c0, c2)
  diff.cima.s(s0, c1, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-cleq(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  âŠ¢ (c0 = c1 â†’ { s0 | { s0 } âˆˆ(c0 " c2)} = { s0 | { s0 } âˆˆ(c1 " c2)})
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylib(c0 = c1, { s0 | { s0 } âˆˆ(c0 " c2)} = { s0 | { s0 } âˆˆ(c1 " c2)}, âˆ€(s0,({ s0 } âˆˆ(c0 " c2)â†” { s0 } âˆˆ(c1 " c2))))
  syl(c0 = c1, âˆ€(s0,({ s0 } âˆˆ(c0 " c2)â†” { s0 } âˆˆ(c1 " c2))), (c0 " c2)=(c1 " c2))
  imaeq1(c0, c1, c2)
  alrimiv(s0, (c0 " c2)=(c1 " c2), ({ s0 } âˆˆ(c0 " c2)â†” { s0 } âˆˆ(c1 " c2)))
  eleq2((c0 " c2), (c1 " c2), { s0 })
  abbi(s0, { s0 } âˆˆ(c0 " c2), { s0 } âˆˆ(c1 " c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, (c0 " c2), (c1 " c2))
  diff.cima.s(s0, c0, c2)
  diff.cima.s(s0, c1, c2)
}
